title: Comparative Esoteric Traditions: Cross-Cultural Mysticism & Alchemy
description: Parallel esoteric traditions from across world cultures: Arabic alchemy and magic (Jabir, Picatrix), Hebrew Kabbalah, Gnostic Mandaean scriptures, Sanskrit Tantra, and Taoist inner alchemy (neidan). Documents universal patterns in mystical and alchemical thought.
curatedBy: Embassy of the Free Mind Collection

researchValue: This collection enables comparative study of esoteric and mystical traditions across major world cultures. Researchers can trace universal patterns in alchemical thought, inner transformation practices, subtle body theories, and sacred symbolism. Essential for comparative religion, history of science, and understanding the global context of Western esotericism.

connections.relationship: Arabic alchemy sources for Latin medieval alchemy; comparative alchemical traditions
Pico's Christian Kabbalah draws on Hebrew mystical sources
